text: I feel for these people deeply. They can not drink their water, bath in it or even cook with it. We here in Indiana have been steady collecting water and sending it to them on truck daily just so they can drink water. Having the amounts of lead they do in their water supply is tragic. Clean water should be available for these people.

Tropical cyclone Vardah packing winds of 100 kilometers per hour (62 miles per hour) and is headed for the Bay of Bengal, Indua. It could create a one meter high storm surge as it makes landfall. Read https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.cnn...s-android-yota

Thirty nine people have died in a horrific accident after a tanker carrying highly flammable chemical lost control and rammed into a number of cars at Kinungi, Naivasha. The tanker is said to have exploded on impact, causing a fireball that engulfed nearby cars Read http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/mobil...nt-rises-to-39

They are just reporting this shooting; so there is not a lot of information a this time. Apparently, at least one person was shot, and they are now saying that the shooter is now in custody.As so often happens, there was a drill just this morning at the Capitol for his very same thing, which always causes confusion because no one is sure what is really happening and what is part of the planned drill.The shooting happened at the visitor area of the Capitol, and the building is still under lockdown, while they are investigating what is going on.

A five storey building has collapsed in Istanbul killing 5 people while dozens others are believed to am trapped. Rescue is still ongoing. Many believe that the building was poorly constructed. This happens after a 17storey building collapsed in Taiwan. The building which collapsed after an earthquake resulted to more than 30deaths with 35 others still missing.

A splinter group of the Taliban is claiming "credit" for the massive explosion in Pakistan that killed at least 60 and injured at least 280. Apparently the attack targeted Christians gathered in celebration of Easter. Truly horrible.http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-35908512

It is being reported that there is a terrorist attack, or multiple attacks, in Brussels, the capital of Belgium. At least 34 are dead and 170 wounded. It is reported that at leas three explosions went off, one of which at the airport. CNN has details and video here.
There is a bad flooding situation going on and five people died. others are in high risk
There is flooding situation and most of the people are rescue and safe, people able to care others and gave attention to help the them.
There is flooding situation and some people need help, 1 or 2 people missing and some of people in risk. some people still hepless
All 62 people on board have been killed, officials have said.Initial reports are that visibility was an issue, and it's not thought to be terror related.

A powerful earthquake that hit Taiwan on Saturday has resulted to more than one 5 deaths. Rescue is still ongoing after a 17 storey building collapsed. It is believed that more than 100 people are still trapped in the collapsed building. The disaster has been attributed to poor construction whereby empty tin cans have been used as part of construction materials instead of concrete. Rescuers mounted hydraulic ladders and a crane to scour the wreckage and have managed to pull out more than 200 people.

Two dams collapsed in Brazil, releasing 16 million gallons escaped, sending a deluge of hazardous sludge into the town of Bento Rodrigues. The town was completely ruined, eleven people were killed, and 12 more reported missing and presumed to be dead In addition a quarter of a million people were suddenly without drinking water.
could hit the country on Sunday evening, whipping up waves, bringing winds of up to 70mph
A new Tropical storm Five is forecast to strike Yemen on 8 November. The storm is expected to bring maximum sustained winds to the region of around 101 km/h (63 mph).

Storms and strong winds lashed across Texas on Saturday, with three radar-confirmed tornadoes damaging homes and causing injuries in the Houston area. At least six people have died since Friday in flood waters in central Texas.

Tropical Storm ERIKA is expected to hit Florida Sunday after causing serious damages in the Carribean. Florida Governor Rick Scott declared a state of emergency on Friday in preparation for the arrival of the storm

A massive explosion shook the northern Chinese city of Tianjin late Wednesday, killing at least 44 people and injuring hundreds more. Reports indicate the explosion started at a warehouse storing "dangerous and chemical goods" .
Flash floods swept through Aberdeen causing extensive damages. Aberdeen Airport was flooded, houses were wrecked and cars submerged under water yesterday as torrential downpours hit the Granite City
About a week ago they measured an earthquake of over 4.0 on the Richter Scale. Nobody was harmed or injured during this quake.

27 people died on the spot and 2 others succumbed to their injuries in hospital later as tragedy hit big time in South Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. People are taking a holy dip in river Godavari, India's second biggest river for which a religious festival is celebrated. Despite huge arrangements and mock drills ahead of the mega ritual, people still died in a stampede as the crowd was said to have been detained to allow the state's chief minister to take a holy dip first.
200 people were rescued by firefighters in Athens from a wildfire being fed by strong winds.

India, Pakistan and Europe have been hit hard with heat waves over the last month and now Japan is suffering through a heat wave of their own which has left 3 people dead and hospitalized more than 3000 others.

Cholera has killed at least 18 people in Juba, capital of South Sudan, in the last three weeks. The current outbreak has affected some 171 people according to the health ministry said. Last year, 167 people died in South Sudan in a cholera outbreak. The cholera outbreak is likely to continue as the rains seasons begins this month.

A heatwave in Karachi and other districts of the southern Sindh province in Pakistan has killed at least 122 people. Karachi has been hit the hardest as scorching temperatures have left 114 people dead. Temperatures in Karachi on Saturday
Ammonia Gas Leak mishap kills 5, leaves more than 140 injured

An explosion at a gas station in Ghana has left 150 dead. The explosion occurred during a storm where many people were sheltering in the gas station. Victims included drivers of public transportation, their passengers and motorists who had stopped to refuel. The cause of the blaze has been blamed on flooding which caused diesel and petrol to flow away from the gas station and into a fire from a nearby house which then led to the explosion.

A petrol tanker lost control and exploded at a crowded bus station in Onitsha, the Anambra's capital, killing 85 people. The explosion started off a huge fire that also spread to many other vehicles, including 15 buses.

The initial reports put the death toll at 69. This was then increased to 70 people a few hours later and then updated again to revise the death toll to 85 people byThe Business Standard. 29 people remain in critical condition.

A passenger ship with around 400 passenger and 40+ crewmembers has sunk in the Yangtze River in China , and they are reporting only about twenty people have been rescued at this time. This is a breaking news story at this time, without many details available about what might have caused the ship to sink.

According to this Xinhua report, the boat sank after being caught in a cyclone while steaming upriver. The AP reports that a total of 10 people - including the ships captain and engineer - have been rescued so far though ongoing rescue operations are being hampered by strong winds and heavy rain.

A total of 15 people have been rescued so far. The ferry itself was carrying mostly elderly Chinese tourists. Relatives of those on board are extremely angry due to what they perceive to be a lack of information regarding the accident itself and whether their loved ones were on board.

I've noticed that only a few people were saved, not even 1/4 of the total number of passengers and it's already a day since the accident happened. That's quite alarming. The crew may not have heard or been forewarned about the cyclone and proceeded with the voyage in good faith. I'm crossing my fingers, hoping there will at least be a hundred or so survivors.

Rivers and Lakes near Dallas have swollen during the bad weather. On Saturday a body had been recovered from standing water. Eleven people are still missing. Storms dumped as much as 7 inch of rain Thursday night.Flooding in the San Jacinto and Colorado rivers was expected to soon subside. The San Jacinto River north of Houston remains in a major flood stage, which should end late Saturday. The Colorado River at Wharton peaked Saturday just shy of major flooding and is predicted to exit flood stage by the evening.

I never expected Texas to experience one of the world's most terrible floods to date since it's a pretty dry place with deserted areas. According to another report, it's not 7 inches but 8 inches of water covering the entire state. Death toll, as of one day ago, has already hit 23.

I mentioned this before on the forum but flooding causes more deaths and damage than any other form of severe weather act in Texas. On average, residents are six times more likely to be killed in a flood than in a tornado. In fact, for many decades now, Texas has led the country in flood fatalities with 612 people killed via flooding from 1960-1995 - more than double the amount of any other state. California was second on the list with 255 flood related fatalities.

It seems twelve people suffered minor injuries as businesses returned to normal Sunday There were no deaths and no Tsunami warnings. The magnitude-7.8 quake struck off the Ogasawara islands Saturday night at a depth of 421 miles, the U.S. Geological Survey said. 400 people were trapped at the observation decks of Tokyo Tower as its elevators stopped for more than one hour. Seismologists have warned Japan to stay vigilant for the next "Big One" Read at

Reports in Kenyan Newspapers indicate that 20 Kenyan police officers have been killed in an ambush by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen near the border with Somalia. This is the latest attack in a series of sustained attacks in Kenya's remote northern counties which border Somalia. The al Shabaab aims to force Kenya to withdraw its troops from the UN-mandated peace keeping force, AMISOM, currently operating in Somalia. However, according to Aljazeera, the Kenyan authorities have denied that any officers died in the attack. Follow at

the authorities late yesterday confirmed there were no deaths during the terror attack. However there is still independent verification of any of the reports. Meanwhile Capital FM has reported that one police officer injured in the attack died today in hospital.

A fire killed at least 38 people in a retiree home in central China. The the fire occurred at 7 on Monday night in Pingdingshan, a city in Henan Province, state-run China Central Television reported. The main fire was extinguished after about an hour, but flames continued to burn in parts of the home for six more hours, the network reported on Tuesday.

Another sad case of neglect. I wonder what the cause was and I must say that I am surprised so many people were arrested. I hope none of them are aged. This does sound a little strange to me. I am sorry for all the poor old dears who died and for their family members who left them there, trusting that they would be taken care of.

To most of us temperatures of 122F are unthinkable, but that is happening in India, where 47,7ºC was registered in northern city of Allahabad and it's expected to rise to 50ºC. These temperatures have already cause the death of over 500 people.
india is facing a scarcity of clean water. More than 100 million people are living in places where water is severely polluted. Only 33% of the country has access to traditional sanitation.

reports that at least 800 people have now died as a result of the heatwave with Andhra Pradesh being hit the hardest where 551 people have died. Further adding to concerns is the possibility of power cuts due to the overuse of air conditioning units. It was also confirmed yesterday that temperatures reached as high as 47 degrees Celsius / 117 degrees Fahrenheit in Angul in Odisha yesterday.
CNN reported this morning that more than 1,100 people have now died in less than a week and the high temperatures are expected to continue for at least another two days before any respite.

Four people were killed on Tuesday when two mortar bombs exploded inside a U.N. compound in the town of Melut in south sudan's Upper Nile state in the latest upsurge in the South Sudan Crisis. Amid the fighting, humanitarian aid groups have pulled out of the hot-spots leaving thousands of people in need.

A cholera outbreak at a refugee camp sheltering thousands of Burundian refugees in northwest Tanzania has killed at least 33 people, a Tanzanian regional health official said on Wednesday. Over 100,000 refugees have fled into Tanzania since the attempted coup last week.

youre right there. The EAC heads of state cannot do anything on the political processes of member countries. The EAC is just a free trade area. However, they are all aware that Burundi could slide into genocide. Based on that Rwanda has indirectly indicated it will send forces if Burundi allows 'militia' from Congo to cross into Burundi. In this case 'militia' refers to the Burundi Presidents tribesmen waging another war in DRC. Rather complex I guess.Having said that, it appears that Burundi is slowly headed for another civil war. Thousands of its citizens have crossed into Tanzania over the past. Protests have been going on in the capital since Monday. Today two people were killed during the protests. If nothing is done by the UN and the International Community the country will soon erupt. Similar thing happened in South Sudan last year. Overall my take is that we are witnessing the making of another African dictator and another failed state

According to this BBC Newsreport, it is estimated that a total of 3,000 people have now been infected with the disease and up to 400 new cases are being diagnosed each day. That is a staggering number.

This information courtesy of Water Aid suggests that 22.3 million - almost half the population - do not have access to safe water and just 12 percent have access to toilets. Sadly, it is no wonder that diseases such as cholera and diarrhea spread so quickly here.

No denying that buddy,but access to clean water is a rarity in some countries and they without a choice take to unclean and unsafe water to stay alive.UN of late hasn't been into "activities" at all.They have actually refrained from doing something over the last couple of months at least.Quite weird and i don't have a reason too. If clean water is accesible and potable.The death rate would drastically come down by at least 25%.

Just as if April 25th didn't suffice there was another harsh blow to Nepal.A 7.3 magnitude struck in the remote mountain districts.Nepal's Home Ministry has raised the death toll from the latest quake to at least 36, while saying another 1,117 people had been injured.

Another Earthquake strikes Nepal, and the tremors have been felt across India yet again. Damage to India has occurred to with loss of life in towns such as Bihar. Large parts of eastern and northern India have been affected by the tremors resulting in buildings to violently shake, and the Delhi Metro to be stopped. The number of lives lost in Bihar is currently 12 and is yet to rise further as the number of causalities rises as data from other villages trickles in.

Today earthquake occurred simultaneously in North India too. Nepal is facing a serious natural catastrophe. Today's earthquake has killed 42 in Nepal and death toll has risen to 17 in India. There is a serious need to disseminate information among public at large about precautions to be taken during earthquake, lets all pray for the best

This was a separate earthquake. The latest news from CNN is that at least 48 people have died in Nepal from this fresh earthquake and another 1,261 people have been injured. It is also reported that at least 17 people have died in India as a result of the tremor, while a woman in Tibet was killed when falling rocks hit her car as she traveled through Gyirong

Fifty people have reportedly been killed in the latest episode of the Turkana - Pokot conflict in Northern Kenya. The killings occurred at Nadome and Kasarani following an attack by raiders and subsequent retaliatory attacks. It is the same region where 21 Administration Police officers were killed last year by Pokot raiders.Baringo County Commissioner Peter Okwanyo said he could not confirm the exact number of deaths because officers were on their way to Nadome and Kasarani where the killings took place. The incident is just one of the many reported in the area since January with the tribes fighting over cattle rustling.

A tornado went through the suburbs of Oklahoma City today, resulting in schools holding children in safe rooms until the storm passed. The twister also damaged homes in Blanchard and Bridge Creek, which are southwest of Oklahoma City. No injuries have been reported thus far. Additional storms are predicted this week

The latest reports state at least 12 people have been injured due to the tornadoes but there have been no deaths. There are also reports that 10 homes were destroyed in Amber and 25 more in Bridge Creek. 7.10 inches of rain was recorded in Norman, OK, making it the wettest May day on record. Furthermore, a flash flood emergency has been issued for the first time in the OKC area as there is the potential for unprecendented levels of rain.

A state of emergency was declared in 12 counties across Oklahoma today as the state continues to recover from severe storms and a reported 51 tornadoes. The Oklahoma City area received the worst of the damage. At least a dozen people were injured in a trailer park and a 43-year-old woman drowned to death after taking cover in an underground storm shelter that was deluged by floodwater.

Today, south Dakota experienced a heavy snowstorm in the western part of the state, as well as a tornado in the eastern part of the state. Nine people have been reported injured , and there is much property damage; but thankfully, everyone survived.

Tornadoes in Texas and Arkansas have killed at least five people, including a young couple in Nashville, Arkansas who died trying to shield their daughter from the storm. Incredibly, the 18-month old girl survived.

In neighboring Texas, a EF3 tornado packing winds of 140-mph pummeled the small city of Van, damaging or destroying as many as 100 homes and leaving 43 people requiring hospitalization. Four people remain in critical condition.

An earthquake has just struck in Japan. The quake was first rated at a 6.1 magnitude, and then downgraded to a 5.7. The quake was reported to be at a shallow depth. At this time, i didn't see any reports of damages or injuries.

I read a little about the rioting yesterday and must say that I'm not at all surprised that this is happening. It's not even about race really is it, more to do with the fact that a man was unnecessarily killed by the police.

The latest is at least seven officers have been injured. I've seen footage of at least one police vehicle (van) burning. The governor has declared a state of emergency and called up the National Guard. Looks like the place is unraveling fast. There are more details

A freak storm today affected parts of Pakistan tearing roofs of buildings and damaging power poles. The storm 45 people and injured more than 200 others. The storm with winds at 120 kph (75 mph) in open space disrupted telecommunications services and damaged infrastructure and crops. A Meteorological Office in Peshawar called it "a completely new phenomenon in this region".

Am very saddened to hear of the loss of lives of 45 people and other people affected. I really hope the government of Pakistan will do something about this issue to prevent more deaths in future and also compensate those people who have lost their properties.

I have not seen this yet. 40 years huh? This makes me remember of the eruption of the famous volcanoes here in the Philippines known as the Mount Pinatubo. Mount Pinatubo erupted and many people were injured and some died. Properties and crops were destroyed causing starvation and other bad effects. I am sure that the volcano in South America as you say will be watched and observed because it might erupt once again and many people will be affected.

Have you heard about this news lately? Check this out! Magnitude 6.1 strong earthquake hits Greece today, the U.S. Geological Surve reported.According to the U.S. Geological Survey, the quake's epicenter was located 47 km SW of Karpathos. It was 13 miles deep.The earthquake's epicenter is at a safer distance from the coast, minimizing the chances of serious damages. I hope that there is no serious harm was inflicted.

That is so terrible, I am glad none has suffered serious injuries. It is bad to be a part of a country that is susceptible to earthquakes. A 6.1 Magnitude is really strong. If I were in a tall building, I would surely be in panic which in case we shouldn't. But honestly our country is in the ring of fire also. It is hard to deal with this kind of act of God.

Great heavens that Greece is not encountering a strongest disaster like the tsunami in Japan that happened in April 2011 ( Miyagi earthquake). That was the most terrible earthquake that caused 15,891 casualties while 2,584 were missing. I am apprehensive with an earthquake now that I grow old.

Well, as if Greece have not had a bad enough year. I am happy that no-one was injured, but I am sorry for the scare it must have given everyone. I was not aware that Greece was in an earthquake zone. I wonder if this does any harm to their tourism trade. I know I will think twice about going there.

Earthquake with a magnitude of 6.1 is really strong but comparing it to the earthquake that has happened in Baguio City, Philippines is far worse. A lot of people have died during the 1990's when an earthquake have destroyed the entire city. There are many casualties causing a lot of damages with regards to properties, roads, buildings, houses, establishments and so on. The city have moved on eventually, but people still remember it and you cn still see the ruins of the said earthquake after so many years.

This is scary and could escalate rapidly if authorities don't quickly determine what it is and how it spreads. So far only 17 or 18 deaths have been reported, but that is out of a total of 23 who showed symptoms. And, they all died within 24 hours!

24 hours is very fast and this shows that the disease is really serious. The spread of the disease is really fast and makes me remember of the Ebola cases out there. The Ebola virus has killed many people in that part of the world and the World Health Organization is doing test and examination to come up with a vaccine for the said virus. I don't know, but I am sure that poverty is something that causes many deaths because many people cannot have proper hygiene, proper nutrition, medication and other necessary things to make themselves healthy and not susceptible to virus, diseases, and illnesse

A late spring blizzard in Wyoming has closed the interstate for at least 100 miles due to an huge pileup involving many semi-trucks , as well as other vehicles. Pictures on Facebook show trucks every which way on the freeway, and traffic is stopped and backed up for miles and miles, as tow trucks work to clear out some of he wrecked vehicles and get the freeway open again. I didn't see any news abotu injuries on this one yet; and hopefully, everyone involved is okay.

Wow, that sounds pretty awful. Looking at the article, it looks like there have been injuries reported, but thankfully no deaths. Hopefully no serious injuries either. I'm curious what originally happened to cause the chain reaction. And hopefully the expected bad weather doesn't cause another pile up.
They are contributing the crash to driving to fast for the weather conditions and loss of control. 27 people so far have been taken to the hospital.

More bad weather across Colorado and Wyoming today caused continued havoc on the roads. 12 people were injured in a crash involving tour buses for two different bands and two trucks on Interstate 70 east of Denver. Heavy fog was believed to have contributed to the crash.The AP reports that the tour bus for the band Twin Shadow rear-ended a semi-trailer that had stopped on the highway, seriously injuring the bus driver. The Twin Shadow tour bus then hit another truck and a tour bus carrying crew members of the band Thompson Square.

Currently they have 15 suspects awaiting trial for multiple homicides, but there may be more involved. In this incident, there were others, there were 105 passengers involved and 12 were thrown overboard to their deaths. The remaining passengers created a human chain which prevented the suspects from tossing them over to. On another ship of 400 passengers, the perpetrators sunk the whole ship and the passengers are presumed dead.

More then a 1000 dogs have been infected in the Mid-Western states of the US in the past year from this fast spreading illness. H3N2 aka Asian Flu Virus was primarily hitting the K-Nine population is the areas of China and South Korea, but in the past year it has spread among the K-Nine population here in the US. So far they have 1,137 cases reported in Chicago alone, 6 of which have died so far, but they believe there are an estimated 5,000 dogs infected with the virus here. It does not appear to be transmittable to humans at the current time.

There have been a string of anti-immigrant riots spreading throughout South Africa. So far 6 people have been killed as a result of these riots. This news article talks about one victim of the rioting in Jeppestown who is seriously injured in the protest that has been occurring for the past two weeks. Protesters are angry because of the immigrants that have been flooding in when their their employment rate is already low and wealth is not distributed equally among citizens.

reports that the riots in South Africa have now spread to Johannesburg where police were forced to fire rubber bullets to disperse crowds of machete-armed residents as they set immigrant businesses on fire. Six people have died as a result of the ongoing attacks, including a 58-year-old who was attacked and killed in his home in Verulam.

A shooting took place in the library of the community College in Goldsboro, NC early this morning. The news reports are that the shootr is still at large, although some of the live tweets are saying that the shooter is barricaded himself n a school bathroom, and won't come out. Another wteeter said that they have one suspect in custody. One person has been reported as killed. This is an ongoing situation at this time.

Several students and teachers became ill due to fumes in the buildings that prompted an evacuation of all the students at Diamond Hill Elementary School. Some of the teachers were taken to a nearby hospital. There were construction crews that were cutting up metal nearby which may have been the cause

At least one very large tornado struck central Illinois today The National Weather Service has confirmed the report and is advising people to take shelter. As of this time, there are not reported injuries, but there is considerable damage

The Chicargo Tribune reports that a second person has died as a result of another tornado. All 71 buildings in Fairdale sustained some damage and 17 homes were knocked off their foundations. At least 11 other people have been taken to hospital while officials report that a few residents remain unaccounted for.

Residents of Fairdale have now been allowed to return home to assess the damage to their properties.The AP reports that a total of 70 buildings were detroyed or damaged in Fairdale and another 50 were hit in nearby Rochelle. All buildings have been searched although not all residents have been accounted for.
Heavy fighting in the refugee camp in Yarmouk Damascus has been taken by ISIL. Here is the news report. Hundreds of civilians are caught in the middle and unable to leave with in the camp.

A Russian trawler sailing in international waters sank today in the Sea of Okhotsk. At least 43 crew members are reported dead. At this writing, 63 crew members have been rescued, but the fate of an additional 26 remains unknown
The AFP has provided an update reporting that at least 54 sailors are now dead while 15 others still remain missing.

Global Times confirmed today that the 43 fishing vessels participating in the search and rescue operations for the 13 people still missing will end on Friday. A MI-8 helicopter will also join the search and rescue operations for the last day although officials have cautioned that it is unlikely they will be found. 56 people have been confirmed dead, with 63 rescued and 13 still missing.
Sadly, but not unexpectedly, the search for the 13 missing sailors was called off today.

The officials say that the water level at Sangam in south Kashmir was recorded at 21.70 feet.The flash floods and incessant rain have damaged bridges and road infrastructure and has caused panic across Kashmir.The water levels in Jhelum are still a cause of worry.A new update says it is receding,I hope no more deaths occur due to this.

The Weather Channel reports that the death toll has now increased to 15 people while fficials are still looking for a 6-year-old boy who remains missing. The article also includes a number of photos showing the two houses that were completely destroyed due to the mudslides.
NDTV reports that 129 bridges were damaged due to the flooding and mudslides while 164 water supply schemes also suffered damage.

We all know about the airstrikes conducted by Saudi Arabia and the US over Yemen to remove the Houthi presence there. Rescue workers are currently combing through the rubble in Saada searching for survivors and bodies after the strikes. I have not found any reports on the death toll as of yet or of the amount of destruction in the region. However, judging from the raw footages I have seen of the strikes... I believe they are going to be real high.

A fast commuter train crashed into the back of a stopped train in Thailand this evening, injuring over 50 people; several of them are in critical condition, including the engineer of the commuter train from Bankok. The report does not say why both trains were on the same track and one train was stopped right in the way of the fast train that was going non-stop fom one city to the other.

3 news reports that of the 52 injured, six remain hospitalized with two in critical condition. The article mentions that six carriages in total had fallen off the tracks and that the two victims fighting for their lives were the driver and technician on board.

An apartment building on Manhatton's East Side has caught on fire and residents are trapped inside; but the building is now collapsing, making it almost impossible for rescuers to get anyone out of the building. The fire apparently started after an explosion rocked the apartment complex, and the fire must have spread very rapidly, because many people were unable to escape. Firefighters are now afraid that the fire may spread to more buildings in the area.
There is an insane amount of smoke that has set of smoke alarms some 40 blocks away. Dozens are reportedly injured with 3 listed in critical condition.

A year ago, two buildings also collapsed in Harlem. The incidents took the lives of eight people and left many others injured. The two buildings, according to CNN, were served by a 127-year-old gas main. Perhaps they need to update their gas mains. They're rather old.

The new york times provided a few new updates tonight, including an update on those injured. Among the 19 people injured, four were firefighters who were taken to hospital for treatment of minor injuries while three others, including one emergency medical worker, declined medical attention at the scene. Four people remain in critical condition.

Mayor Bill de Blasio said today that someone may have inappropriately accessed the gas line internally before the explosion. Mayor de Blasio also provided an update on those injured. According to the latest numbers, 22 people were injured, 4 critically so. There have been no fatalities although 2 people are unaccounted for

One adult died and multiple other's were injured after a tornado swept through central Oklahoma on Wednesday. The National Weather Service issued a warning as the tornado headed towards Tulsa with 24,000 people losing power and some areas hit by flooding.

ABC News has been providing regular updates on Tropical Cyclone Nathan. In their latest update, they report that some people in north Queensland have had their roofs damaged and the small Indigenous community of Hope Vale (population of approximately 500 people) is currently without power while its vital banana farm has also been damaged.

Authorities have reported that at least four people have been shot and they are searching for the shooter at this point. One person reported dead so far. Schools and the college campus are all on lockdown, and paramedics are reporting urgent calls for medical attention aat several places in the area. This is just now happening; so not a lot of information seems to be available yet.

The latest news courtesy of Arizona Central is that 6 people have been shot and 1 person killed. The shooter, believed to be a white male in his 40s, is still on the loose and police are actively searching for him.
An explosion ripped through an Exxon-Mobil refinery today. Firefighting poured water on the burning facility. The multi-storied was shattered. Four people received minor injuries.
My God, the place looks like it was blasted by a nuke. Thank goodness only 4 people were hurt and their injuries were minor. A accident like that could have been very disastrous.

The four contractors that suffered minor injuries have now been released from the hospital.This LA Times article reports that eight workers had to be decontaminated following the blast and that the white ash substance seen in the photos posted by ASurvivor above may pose inhalation risks.

The photo definitely looks impressive. Like something out of an action-disaster movie. As for the explosion, these things probably happen quite often and don't always get reported. I am glad that the workers only suffered minor injuries. I just wonder if they were poisoned in any way, and whether the neighborhood was affected by it. I guess there wouldn't be many residential homes in the surrounding area, but then I could be wrong.

Heavy rains have caused flooding in Peru with some of the districts of the forest areas are under a state of emergency. as a result of weeks of rains. The floods have affected more than 30,000 people leaving at least 2,000 are homeless. The floods have also affected 75,000 people in Bolivia and 15,000 people in Columbia since October.

36 people were killed yesterday in Bagdad (Iraq) after suicide bombers exploded in a market and restaurant of the Iraqi city. Over 100 people were injured in the attack and Iraq continues without peace...

Tropical storm Chedza has left a trail of destruction from flooding in 4 Southern Africa nations. In Madagascar 68 people were killed and 130,000 displaced when the tropical storm Chedza hit. The monetary damage in the country is estimated at more than $40 million, mainly from massive degradation of key infrastructure. In Malawi, one of the world's poorest countries 62 people were killed and 153 registered as missing. In neighboring Mozambique, 144,330 had been affected with 86 killed and an estimated 11,000 houses destroyed. The economic damage is likely to run in to billions - in previous floods of year 2000, the world bank estimated that Economic looses from the floods run to over $1 billion.
Reuters reports that the number of deaths in Mozambique has increased to triple figures with 150,000 others displaced due to the flooding.

The recent flooding in Malawi may actually lead to something positive. The floods, which affected some 638,000 people have been affected, with 174,000 left homeless, killed 79 people and left 153 missing seem to have forced the government to rethink its disaster response strategy. The cabinet in the country is now considering a new draft policy on managing disaster risk to replace the country's country's 1991 Disaster Preparedness and Relief Act which focused on post-disaster relief. A now disaster risk management law is likely to considerably reduce losses in future floods which overall is a good thing.

Torrential flooding in Malawi has lead President Peter Mutharika to declare the African country a disaster zone. At least 48 people have been killed due to the flooding and left around 70,000 people homeless.

The bad weather continues to prove it's strength and 48 people dead and 70,000 homeless people are scary numbers. The fact that the crops are damaged can also have a terrible impact in the future of the country, I hope that international help can give them a good hand.

The New York Times provides a brief update this morning as they report that 176 people have now been killed due to the flooding with another 153 unaccounted for. The latest numbers reveal that at least 200,000 have been displaced.
The latest reports state that 260 people have died as a result of the flooding and with Tropical Storm Chedza making its way into Malawi, that number could continue to rise.

Over 1,000 people are homeless today afer a massive fire destroyed a huge apartment complex in New Jersey. The luxury condos were completely destroyed in the blaze , which covered several blocks in area, and was declared a disaster after the fire. 400 condos burned in the fire, and this is exacly the smae area where apartments burned 14 years ago, destroying the apartments and home that existed there at that time.

On location and writing - amazed that we still have internet! The U.S. embassy sent out an emergency message just in time. Tropical Storm Chedza hit Madagascar today near Morandava with winds between 60 and 70 km/hour. It is moving eastward and currently above our heads in the highlands area at a speed of 9 km/h. Its center is likely to make landfall soon or may have already. Regions in the southwest area are under red alert (meaning imminent danger) and the capital of Antananarivo is under Yellow alert (meaning threat...this is near where we are located, but south of there). As a precaution schools have been closed the last couple days due to risk of flooding. Winds may increase in excess of 90/km/hour over the next 12 hours. One house across the family from where we live has already crumbled (made of clay). But ours is very strong so at no risk. The storm's progress can be monitored at the World Meteorological Organization's website.

The subway began to fill with smoke as the train was going from one station to the next one, forcing the train to stop and try to back to the station that it had just left. As the car filled with smoke, people were unable to breath, and some collapsed on the floor of the subway car. It was almost 45 minutes before rescue firefighters were able to get to the smoking train and start helping people to safety, and one person has died and over 85 others were injured .

Terrorists entered a museum in Tunis and held almost 200 people hostage before authorities were able to get inside the museum, kill the terrorists, and free the hostages. Many of the hostages were women and children, according to what the pictures look like. Around seventeen of the people killed in the attack were torists according to the latest reports.

I just received a news alert about this attack. It is now being reported that at least 22 people were injured in the attacks. reported that "television footage showed dozens of people, including elderly foreigners and one man carrying a child, running for shelter in the compound next to the parliament, covered by security forces aiming rifles into the air."

The death toll has now increased to 23 people, including 20 foreign tourists. According to the BBC 9 people have been arrested in connection with the attack. It is believed that 4 were directly linked to the attack and 5 others had ties to the cell.

News services are just now reporting that there was a 6.6 earthquake in northern South America, in Bogota, the capital of Columbia.Some reports are saying that people are being evacuated, but there is not much information available at this time
As of this point, there are no casualties. All people have been taken to safety.

40 people were injured when a passenger train collided with a tractor trailer a few hours ago. There were no life threatening injuries. Here are two videos. One is of the news report. The other is a witness video of the crash as it was happening. Hundreds of people were affected by this crash as railways are shut down until they are able to get the train out of the way. The engine is still laying on its side.
The AP mentions that a total of 55 people were injured in the crash. However, federal authorities believe that as many as 62 were believed to be injured.

Florida is facing a serious threat from dengue fever and chikungunya. According to the The Florida Department of Health dengue fever had been confirmed in 24 people and Chikungunya in 18 people. The diseases, which are viral and spread by mosquito bites, could kick off an epidemic in the state if not controlled.
Along with the 54 killed 143 victims were seriously wounded in the attacks.

Madagascar is struggling to respond to the twin disasters of flooding and drought. The central highlands region of the country, including the capital, Antananarivo is suffering from increasingly severe flooding while in the south the country is battling a prolonged drought. The current flooding is just the latest disaster after Tropical Storm Chezda swept through the country leaving 68 dead and 80,000 displaced.
A rare snowstorm just hit Lebanon and killed three Syrian refugees. The bodies were found between the border of Syria and Lebanon

NASA have released some spectacular images showing the devastation caused in South Australia by the current bush fires, which are now in their sixth day. Captured by a Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MRIS), massive amounts of smoke are billowing over the Adelaide hills. Thankfully, there have been no fatalities, but around 135 people have been injured.
Mt. Sinabung erupted Saturday effecting three districts, Tiganderket, Payung and Lau Balang, and has so far killed 14 people and severely burned 3 others. Over 25,000 residents forced to evacuate.

Mt. Sinabung continues to erupt, this time causing forest fires in North Sumatra which ultimately led to the cancellation of and disruption of flights at nearby Kuala Namu airport. Forested areas along the Lau Borus River were destroyed by the pyroclastic flow during the most recent eruptions. Officials fear that the scale of eruptions is rising and will continue to do so. This eruption was the biggest in recent weeks though as of this writing there were no reports of any injuries.

354 people injured and 14 requiring amputations due to the New Years celebration. Apparently this is not a shock. This appears to happen every year. I think that it may be time to ban New Years in the Philippines if it is this bad

Two car bombs killed at least 31 people, including 20 children, in central Yemen's Radaa city when suspected al Qaeda fighters targeted Houthi militants Tuesday, senior security officials and locals told CNN.

The children were not the intended target as the bombs were made to set off at a Houthi gathering point but one of the bombs blew up next to a bus carrying school children home. ALL 20 CHILDREN THAT DIED were under the age of 12.

Just as the hostage situation in Syney has finally come to a close, a new report has come out of a gunman who has shot and killed at least 5 people in three different houses, and is currently barricaded in one of the houses. They think that it may have something to do with a custody issue, and there are apparently several children involved.

There also appears to be some discrepancy regarding how many people have been killed as some media outlets are reporting four people have been confirmed dead, while others claim five people have died so far.
Flash flooding has been reported in San Jacinto Valley in California. The flooding trapped fourteen individuals in vehicles, though fortunately no one was injured.

Three people have died as the result of an Islamic terrorist attack in the Philippines this week, and at least 24 more people were taken to the hospital with injuries after the explosion. This is the second such attack in the last few weeks, and the terrorists placed the bomb outside of a restaurant, where it exploded and caused a massive fire as a result.

It is scary to say the least.The "death zone" as they call it is a slow killer where you are deprived of the oxygen material since the pressure is lesser than 5 psi.Especially the 1996 tragedy where 8 died making an attempt.That season alone there were 15 fatalities.

Wow, I did not hear about this. Although, considering the drought that has been affecting California for the past few months, it's not a surprise that a torrential downpour was due. I'm not sure how common mudslides are in California, but I definitely hope that the local emergency services are equipped to deal with the situation and that no one was hurt.

This Sunday a suicide bomber exploded himself in the middle of the crowd that was assisting a volleyball match in Afghanistan. Apart from the 45 victims there are several dozens of injured, many of them in critical condition. Will there ever be peace in this region of the world?

The Fogo volcano at Cape Verde, which is just off of the west coast of Africa, has just erupted. It is sending plumes of smoke and ash into the sky, and the residents have been warned that they need to evacuate the area. At this point there are no reported deaths or injuries, but the volcano has had some serious eruptions in the past, although not in recent years.

A strong earthquake shook central Japan on Saturday night, injuring at least 39 people and destroying many homes in the well-known ski resort of Hakuba. The USGS reported the 'quake as a 6.2-magnitude. Seven of the people hurt suffered serious injuries.

That's terrible that there were people seriously hurt but I am so glad there was no damage to any nuclear power plant. I'm sure the whole country is breathing a sigh of relief to know that at least in that area, everything is OK.

Unfortunately everything is not OK. The damage is much more extensive than initially thought. A daylight assessment found at least 50 homes had been destroyed and 41 people injured, including seven with broken bones. A number of non-residential buildings were also destroyed, 200 people needed to be evacuated to shelters and multiple roads were severely damaged. Additionally, more than 20 people were trapped under collapsed houses.

This is pretty serious. I found an article in Mail Online News in the UK stating,Over 300,000 Americans have already been infected with the potentially fatal 'kissing bug disease' called Chagas,Chagas is being called the new AIDS because of its asymptomatic beginnings that can turn to a fatal end if the disease progresses,Many doctors aren't aware of the prevalence of Chagas and aren't testing people for the disease

A suicide bomber entered this Monday in a Nigerian school disguised as a student and killed at least 47 student. 79 more people were injured and this happened in the same city where last week 30 people that were in a religious procession were killed. Will there be an end to this?

There were kids on the ship that were on a trip. They were among the people who died. Altogether there were 416 people on board and 306 died.There were several crew members who were also arrested with the Captain.

I saw this on the news tonight. They also reported that at least six people died and nearly 30 are missing after rain caused a landslide on a stretch of road in Southern Colombia. Apparently the landslide was so bad that the cars and motorists inside were completely buried.

A religious excursion in Murcia (Spain) ended in the worse possible way when the bus fell off a 15 meter high cliff causing 14 dead and 28 injured. The causes of the accident are not clear yet, but this is already considered the third worse bus accident in Spain since 2000.

A bacteria called "legionella" has 54 people in the hospital in Portugal and the first patient died today. The origin of the contamination is still undetermined so everyone is concerned because they don't know if further cases will appear. Do you have similar cases where you live?

What a terrible, terrible tragedy. The report seems to indicate that there more than 150 people could be trapped. 250 disaster response personnel are on the scene assisting local police and ambulance workers. Television footage showed a chunk of hillside giving way and a cascade of mud, rocks and trees sparking clouds of dust below. Sadly, landslides are more widespread than any other geological event.

It was the worst one last year in uttarakhand..more than 6000 were killed.The area surrounding it has been deforested extensively..and to hinder rescue operations,it is still raining cats and dogs there.

Nothing could have been done..Deforestation..and overpopulation are the primary reasons..The hilly regions are never a safe place to stay,but what can these poor people do..? They cannot afford a bungalow in a posh area..Hoping they can rescue as many as possible..There are more than 150 still trapped under.

Sadly, the death toll has now raised to 31 and there are still another 150 people still feared missing and unaccounted for. Chances of rescuing any of these missing people appears to be slim as it has been more than 36 hours since Wednesday's landslide. Apparently, the disaster only came to light when a bus driver passed by and saw that the village had been wiped out.
The latest reports out of India indicate that 44 houses were completely flattened by the landslide disaster. 70 people have been confirmed dead, including 28 males, 32 females and 10 children.

The death toll is rising, and I'm struck by horror at how much. It seems as though these disasters are always made worse by the conditions these people live in, the kind of hell people have to endure to live in these places is unimaginable.

The village is on the verge of extinction with nearly 20 dead and many others critically injured.Total population of the village is 700 and nearly 150 were critical...250 still feared trapped..I sincerely pray for their well being.!!!

The latest reports have the death toll at 79 people with 8 people rescued alive. A spokeswoman for the National Disaster Management Authority said today that they are expecting to pull out a total of 153 bodies.

About 160 people were buried under mud and rocks after heavy rainfall during the night that led to a rapid landslide. At least 25 have been killedd and another 200 feared to be trapped under mud and debris. Rocks and mud destroyed people's homes after a nearby hill collapsed. Mind you this was a remote and poor village with very weak structured dwellings.

A series of landslides resulting from a heavy tropical storm have killed at least seven people in the Cao Loc district in northern Vietnam. A 5-year old girl and her mother were among those killed in the landslide.

More than 100 people have been buried under tons of mud and rubble for two days as a massive landslide hit central Sri Lanka. Hundreds of troops have been using heavy equipment to dig through tonnes of mud that buried the tin-roofed homes of workers at a tea plantation. Authorities have evacuated hundreds of people from nearby villages due to fears of fresh landslides. Unfortunately, bad weather has hampered rescue and recovery efforts.
A landslide triggered by torrential rain has killed at least 3 people and left 107 others missing on Indonesias main island of Java.

The town of Frank, Canada was nearly wiped out in 1903, when a massive landslide off of Turtle mountain crushed and killed 90 people. Although some signs were present, such as cracks, no one had expected the great mass and velocity. As with any landslide, various factors likely contributed to the landslide, including warm days and cold nights, which caused further cracking. One theory is that there was a layer of air within the mass, and when it finally came loose, the debris rode on this cushion, causing greater causalities. There are now 80 monitoring devices on the mountain, and the human activities are further away from the base of Turtle mountain. But will it be enough? Can we ever really predict something as random as a rockslide?
A landslide in Bosnia has killed one and injured three others so far. Seven homes were destroyed as a result of the slide as the homes were built over an old abandoned coal mine which collapsed.

A small plant which had engine trouble right after takeoff crashed into a flight-training building at the Wichita , Kansas , killing at least four people. Five more are hospitalized and several other are totally missing. Because of the seriousness of the explosion and resulting fire, rescue workers were not able to look for other possible survivors, and the part of the building also collapsed, making any efforts impossible.

4 people where hurt in a train wreck Tuesday in Indiana when a Amtrak train crashed into a Semi-truck. This accident was pure human error. The driver of the truck incorrectly calculated the distance and amount of time he had to rush across the tracks when he clearly saw an Amtrak train coming his way. When we have to make decisions that effects whether a person lives or die we should be more diligent in our assessment and maybe, just maybe decide not to the darn thing. --peace

A terrific storm raged through the Buenos Aires region of Argentina, flooding rivers, destroying homes, and causing the evacuation of over 1000 residents in the area. The local power companies are reporting that over 50,000 homes in the area are without power at this time.

I honestly believe they will be able to stop the Ebola outbreak from reaching Europe. The USA is far, far away and there is nothing to be concerned about. Yes, you have 2 people infected with Ebola in the USA, but they are being handled with extreme care, so you shouldn't worry too much about Ebola spreading to anyone else, since it is not airborne.
Seven people have died and a further 20 people remain missing after a landslide hit a village in Southwest China on Wednesday, August 27

A surprise blizzard trapped over 250 hikers in the Himalayan Mountains of Nepal, killing at least 23 people, and many others are still missing. Searchers and military are on the mountain area looking for any possible survivors, and bringing down the bodies as they are finding them.it appears that many of the hikers were probably trapped in the avalanche, since over 250 ikers were signed in through the park checkpoint, and have not yet been found.

I just saw this on the news now. Very sad. The death toll has grown to 29 people but at least 82 people are still missing. Although more than 200 people were rescued,is reporting that the Nepalese government is being heavily criticized for not doing enough to help in the aftermath of the storms as the initial assistance was limited to just two army helicopters.

After four days of searching, 384 people have been rescued though 22 people still remain stranded at Thorung La pass and face a shortage of food and water. Army helicopters tried to rescue them but failed after being unable to land. Many of the 384 people that have been rescued have been left with severe frostbite and will need to have limbs amputated.

After five days of search and rescue operations, rescue teams in Nepal say that there are now no trekkers left stranded. They are now focused on recovering bodies buried in the snow, though it is unclear how many people may still be missing.

is reporting that the death toll has now reached 43. Of the 43, 21 were foreign trekkers and mountaineers from countries including India, Israel, Canada, Poland, Japan, China and Slovakia. Twenty-two were Nepalese guides, porters and villagers. Officials said 518 people including 304 foreign trekkers were rescued in the operation.
Meanwhile, Greece was also hit with a 5.5 magnitude earthquake at 23:43:15.20 UTC on Friday, October 24. There are no reports of damage or injuries.

Greece continues to feel the affects of Hurricane Gonzalo as flash flooding has led to severe damage in several places including Peristeri, Ilion and Parama. It was reported today that at least 250 cars have been swept away as a result of the flooding and emergency crews have been called upon to pump water out of at least 800 homes and businesses. Prime Minister Antonis Samaras has pledged aid to affected areas.

I heard that the number dead are 8 so far. (Just to update the posts that have already been made) Also wind speeds reached 121 mph, at the latest report. 70% of communications have been lost. Certain states in India do have disaster management departments but they do not know yet how to aces the total damage done. India is no stranger to cyclones which often damage rice paddies, however, this one in particular is striking in the middle of the harvest season. More than 2,000 rescuers have been deployed to help in relief efforts. While sad, the advanced technology that India now uses has made death tolls much less than in years past. In the 1970's much milder cyclones had killed 100s of people. Lets hope technology keeps advancing so that one day there won't be a death count.

The death toll as a result of Hudhud has now risen to 38. Power is finally being restored and department officials are hopeful that power in 80 percent of Vizag will be restored by Saturday, however, many are still facing serious water problems.

A 7.1 earthquake is a really strong quake. In fact, this makes it tied for the eight strongest earthquake of 2014,Fortunately, it appears that no one was injured.This seems very lucky, especially considering the 2010 earthquake that struck just off the coast of Chile's Maule region that measured 8.8 in magnitude killed more than 500 people.

It's really incredible nobody was injured with a quake of that magnitude! I can hardly believe it. Are quakes common in Chile? I have always wanted to visit there. I won't be able to for a few years but I'd like to at some point in my life time.

A truck driver with a lorry rammed into at least one vehicle near Thessolonica in Greece, creating a massive pile-up that killed five people immediately, and left others in serious condition in the hospital. The driver failed to stop at a road construction site, and stated that his brakes had failed on the lorry that he was driving.

A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck off the coast of Northern Japan at 7:35pm Friday local time. There were no initial reports of damage or injuries and according to the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center, there is no threat of a tsunami.

As of 11 p.m. EDT on Saturday, Vongfong was downgraded to a tropical storm though not before 31 people were injured. 53,000 households in Okinawa and more than 50,000 in Kagoshima were experiencing blackouts as of Sunday morning. Authorities also advised the evacuation of 90,000 households in Okinawa and 2,700 in Kagoshima Prefecture due to the possibility of flooding and mudslides.

One person died in Uganda's capital of Kampala after being infected with Marburg, a highly infectious hemorrhagic fever similar to Ebola. A further 80 people who came into contact with him were quarantined.
I just read of an early report of a 6.0 magnitude earthquake that has struck China's Yunnan province. An earthquake in that region killed hundreds of people in the province this past summer.
Early reports indicate that 2 people have died and a further 324 people have been injured. 8,750 Armed Forces, including 248 officers and soldiers immediately rushed to the scene of the earthquake.

A 4.9-magnitude earthquake has rocked the small farming town of Misca in Peru leaving at least 8 people dead and causing damage to at least 300 homes. Peru's President Ollanta Humala has declared a state of emergency for 90 days with the possibility to extend this if needed.

Unfortunately, earthquakes are all too common in Peru as the Nazca and South American tectonic plates located near its coast. In 2007, more than 500 people were killed in Peru's coastal province of Ica when a 7.9-magnitude undersea earthquake struck.

Mount Ontake, a 10,000 foot volcano in the bordering both the Nagano and Gifu prefectures of central Japan, erupted last night (02:53 GMT) spewing gas and ash high into the atmosphere. Eight people are missing and more than 40 are reported injured (32 seriously, including 7 that lost consciousness). More than 250 people were stranded at the top of the mountain. Japan's meteorological agency declared a level 3 alert (out of 5) advising people to stay away from the mountain. As of yet, no lava flows have been reported. Mount Ontake last erupted in 2007.

The fact that people were hiking means the eruption must have been very sudden and without much warning. Its difficult to tell when nature will unleash it's unforgiving wrath. This volcano was known to be semi-dormant and the eruption itself was not very powerful. Still, reports of missing persons rose to 32 today.

I  think, sadly, there is a high chance that the number rises based on the fact that there are still 45 people reportedly missing.is reporting that a total of 31 people have been confirmed dead to date.

The death toll has climbed to 36. To make matters worse, toxic gases and ash is still erupting from the mountain forcing rescue workers to half their recovery operation. More than 200 soldiers and firefighters, including units with gas detection equipment, were part of the search before it was brought to a halt.

Five more bodies have been discovered on the slopes of the mountain. 24 bodies still remain on the mountain, while 12 have been recovered, identified and pronounced dead.The recovery efforts continue to be hampered by the conditions as the volcano continues to shoot hydrogen sulfide gas, rocks and ash into the air.

is reporting that the death toll has now climbed to 48 as rescuers continue searching the mountain for bodies. Around 1,000 people are currently involved in the rescue operations with helicopters used to bring the bodies down from the mountain.
Japanese doctors have determined that almost all of the people died as a result of injuries from being hit by rocks that flew out of the volcano during its eruption.
As the search continued this morning,rescue workers have found three more bodies bringing the total number of deaths to 50.
Just to keep this thread updated, the evening news reported that rescue workers have retrieved a fourth body today raising the death toll to 51.
Rescue workers discovered three more bodies yesterday in the ash on Mount Ontake bringing the death toll to 54. At least 12 more hikers are still unaccounted for following the eruption.

Pathologists confirmed that of the 56 people who died when the volcano erupted, 20 were killed instantly when they were struck in the head or neck by falling rocks and debris. One doctor involved in the case told the,however, that around half of the victims they saw had been taking photos of the eruption when they died.

About 40 of the terrorists were either killed or injured and captured by the Chinese police, who quickly responded to the scene of the terrorist attack. About 50 people were killed, and another 54 injured, although Radio Free Asia puts the abount of injured at closer to 100 people.
I read about this earlier in the day. There are no reports of death, as of this writing.Fortunately, there  no tsunami expected according to the USGS.

I wonder if the tougher building codes and regulations have anything to do with less destruction. There may have been damage to property but no loss of life. I'm sure people were injured but getting killed is much worse.
Good thing the earthquake didnt resulted to casualties. Only minor damages to properties were reported. And residents were shocked at the incident as they dont experience quakes as strong as that.

earthquake struck just off the coast of Santiago, Chile; and close to Easter Island. The area had several smaller quakes before the large one hit, and it was soon followed by a 6.6 aftershock, and then several smaller ones. No one was hurt as far as is known at this time, but over 300 people were evacuated from the Easter Island lowlands because of the possibility of a tsunami being generated from the earthquake
More heavy rain has hit India o er the last two days resulting in flooding, landslides and the death of at least 28 people to date.

In this June till october months,we can call that they are prone to all this.In gauhati too,a couple of months back it left 11 people dead,so till october,we sadly will be seeing more of this happen.The setting of relief centers has become a major problem now.It is only going to increase in the next 36 hrs acc to forecast.
The latest reports reveal that as many as 73 people have been confirmed dead as a result of the flooding and landslides in the northeast. More than 20 people still remain missing.

Although the recent weather reports that the flood situation is improving due to reduced rain, there are serious concerns that the Brahmaputra River and its tributaries are still flowing above the danger levels in several places.

73 dead and with 20 people still missing thats already a lot of casualties. And I believe India has made a lot of recent development in the year and being hit with this disaster will certainly have an effect on their economy. The government are now making efforts to provide the affected citizens temporary shelter. Though India belongs in the third world country the government is still trying to make ends meet.
The entire region is still on a state of maximum alert due to the flooding as rescue workers are reportedly struggling to reach homes cut off by the rising waters.

Approximately 50,000 people have been rescued by boats and helicopters in South Pakistan. Around 24 people have been killed within the last 24 hours due to the raging floods, raising the death toll from rains and flooding to 346 people.
This sounds really bad. According to reports  3 people have died and tens of thousands have been displaced due to the flooding.
Hurricane Odile came ashore as a category 3 hurricane and has caused massive destruction along Mexico's Baja coastline. So far there are about 135 reported injuries, but no losses of life.

Local authorities reported today that almost 6 million people living in provinces of Hainan, Guangdong and Guangxi have been affected in some form by typhoon Kalmaeg. 7 people have been killed and another person is missing while almost 700,000 hectares of crops have been hit and 1,600 houses detroyed w5th damages reaching almost $14 million.

Hearing stories like this is almost another world to me. The country I live in has absolutely nothing like this. No hurricanes or tornados and especially no typhoons. I can never imagine what it's like to be under the fear of it happening and everything you own being destroyed like that. While any death is a tragedy, for it's scale it's surprising that only 7 people died and 1 person is missing. Is there anywhere where I can help out in some way?
To date, 45 people have been confirmed dead as a result of typhoon Kalmaegi. The damage is estimated at a staggering $75 million.

The area that were hit in the recent typhoon was Isabela region, cagayan, central and northern luzon and also parts of visayas. There were atleast 10 reported dead in the Philippines and caused landslides, flash floods and large waves which sank a stalled ferry and which killed eight people. Sadly the Philippines is expecting another natural disaster to transpire which is the eruption of Mayon volcano.

BEIJING  Heavy rains in Chinas southwest have killed at least 19 people and left 20 missing, with tens of thousands of people evacuated due to flooding, state media reported Monday.The China News Service reported that 12 people had died in the city of Chongqing, three in neighboring Sichuan province and another four in Shaanxi province. Some 160,000 people had been evacuated from Shaanxi alone with another 85,000 from Sichuan.

In connection with the recent heavy rains in China, Typhoon Kalmaegi has left at least seven people dead and one missing.. The typhoon, the 15th typhoon to hit China this year, made landfall in Hainan with more than 1,000 houses collapsed and millions of people affected.

Mt. Slamet volcano in Jakarta has been erupting for the last several days, and on September 11th, it erupted a total of 38 times. Local authorities said the volcano has produced plumes of ash and lava as high as 5,000 feet into the air.The volcano is one of several in the area, and it is now at an orange alert. People that live near the volcano have been told to evacuate .

While Pakistan has conducted rescue operations and rescued thousands of people from the disaster, the flood levels keep rising in Multan City, prompting the government to increase efforts to rescue people and protect property. The government was not expecting floods of such magnitude, which is the worst they have seen since 2010.

A small German village of about 14,000 people suffered serious damage when a chemical plant unexpectedly exploded and burst into flames. The explosion seriously injured one person, thought to be a missing worker who went back inside after the alarm went off, and he was rushed to the hospital with third degree burns over his entire body.The blast was so powerful that it rocked the whole area, and damaged over thirty nearby homes. The resulting blaze from the fire could be seen for miles, it was so large and raging out of control. Firefighter and emergency personnel from all around the area came to help fight the fire.
So much damage and 2 deaths in just a few days? Mother nature is one heck of a force to be reckoned with. I hope that at least there won't be any more deaths!

It is unfortunate that the flooding has resulted in the deaths of 2 women. The monsoon season has been devastating all over the world this year. More rain is expected in Arizona, so we have to see how that affects the situation. I was able to catch a video of the flood including people stuck in their cars awaiting rescue.

More than 100 people have been killed in Indian Kashmir's worst flooding for half a century. Soldiers have been brought in as part of the rescue operation as thousands of people still remain trapped as the main city of Srinagar is flooded under water.
Officials declared today that at least 200 people have been killed so far due to the flooding.

Across the border too it hasn't spared people.In Pakistan,the flash floods and house collapses from days of heavy rain have left another 193 people dead.More than 350 villages have been submerged now.108 in pakistan.

It's very good news to hear there are no deaths or injuries associated. The increased seismic activity probably did have them on alert since it is something in their immediate environment that they have to be watchful for.

Thank goodness no one died or was seriously injured. Volcanoes are very beautiful. I admit that watching a video of one erupting can be really captivating. I guess that when it comes to Mother Nature, not all beautiful things are innocent. Many of them are deadly.

The monsoon season is always a hard time for India and Pakistan, and surrounding area, but thi year's monsoon season is already said to be the worst one in decades, with more rains and flooding still expected. Reports are saying that hundreds of people have already died in the floods and rains, and people are being evacuated by the military and rescue workers, some by helicopter. Most of the people who have been killed are believed to have died when the roofs of their homes collapsed due to the rains. Even more rain is expected, but rescue workers are hoping to get as many people as possible into safer areas.

The number of deaths as a result of the flood is 355 and set to increase in the coming days. The situation is very sad, but there is hope as both countries have set their recent tensions aside, and are willing to help each other in this situation. Rescue operations by the Indian army resulted in the rescue of 20,000 people for the moment. I have included a link to the news, which also includes a video with aerial footage of the floods.

The heavy monsoon flooding has now killed 523 people and affected 2 million people in Pakistan and Indian-controlled Kashmir. Of those, 200 died in the India-controlled part of the Himalayan region, 64 in Pakistani-controlled Kashmir, as many as 246 people perished across Pakistan. Another 13 were killed in the northern Gilgit and Baltistan province.

On Friday, a new forest fire started in the area near Yosemite National Park. Today, the wildfire was still out of control, with only 25% of the fire contained. At this point 300 homes have been evacuated, and another 400 homes are also threatened, and the residents have been warned to be ready to evacuate if the fire is not able to be controlled. As of now, no injuries are reported, and hopefully, everyone will be able to get themselves, their pets, and any livestock they have safely out of harms way.

is reporting that almost half a million people have been made homeless due to flooding through villages in northern Bangladesh. A week of flash flooding has washed away roads and damaged crops. Officials have warned that heavy monsoon rains could cause fresh areas to be submerged in the next few days.
Another bad storm hit Bangladesh today, killing 24 people and injuring more than 50 other people. Several houses were damaged, trees were uprooted and many have been without power for several hours

newspaper reports that 36 people have now died as a result of storms across Bangladesh. The paper reports that 20 people died in Bogra while five people died in Dhaka and the rest in other northern areas as well as in the southwest of the country. It was reported that most of the victims died when their houses collapsed in the storm while others were electrocuted by falling wires

Sadly, the death toll continues to rise with 41 people now confirmed to have died.reports that more than 200 people have been injured and that the storm could continue to spread throughout the rest of the country in the coming days.

More storms and heavy flooding continue across Bangladesh as 10 people were killed yesterday and 15 others injured in three districts across the country. It was reported that two people died when they were buried alive in a mudslide triggered by torrential rains.

Goodness it struck a sparsely populated area and all he more happy that it didn't cause any injury or damage.It could have caused a tsunami along coasts within 100 Km.Major quakes in 3 nations within 36 hours or so..chile california and peru..sounds like there is a connection.

Northern California has suffered an earthquake measuring 6.0 on the Richter scale during the nite. This is the largest quake to hit this part of California since the Loma Prieta quake in 1989. The quake was in the San Francisco region of Northern California, and about 7 miles deep.Although there have been reports of a lot of damages to homes and property, so far there are no reported injuries.

New buildings have to be quake proof as much as possible, older buildings have to be retrofitted..has it got something to do with underground excavations in Union Square.Thankfully no one lost their lives.

That's a pretty big quake. I'm glad to read that there aren't any deaths reported yet. (Article has been updated to a couple of major injuries and lots of minor to moderate injuries.) Given that the people seem to be safe, I wonder what this will do the the year's grape crop. Sonoma and Napa Valleys have a lot of vineyards and produces a lot of California's wine. I can see this having a huge long-term impact.
As of this writing, there have been no reported fatalities, but there are injuries. There is a massive amount of property damage and at least one good sized fire.
reports that at least 87 people have been taken to hospital with three of them seriously injured.
are that six people sustained critical injuries, including a young child.

Remains of a boat that was carrying 200 illegal migrants from Africa was found were found offshore of Libya by the Libyan Coast Guard. 16 survivors were found thus far, along with 15 bodies. Searching continues for the remaining 170 people. So far, they have identified individuals of both Somalis and Eritreans nationalities.

This has been confirmed as NOT Ebola. They are thinking it's haemorrhagic gastroenteritis. A total of 592 cases have been reported including 70 deaths. Medical personnel are among the deaths so it is believed to be communicable between humans. The first case, a pregnant woman (the woman died, but the baby was delivered via caesarean section), presented with fever, diarrhea and vomiting, blood in the urine and upper gastrointestinal bleeding. The outbreak is believed to have started in Mid-July and has spread to several areas.

What a terrible, terrible tragedy. The report seems to indicate that there more than 150 people could be trapped. 250 disaster response personnel are on the scene assisting local police and ambulance workers. Television footage showed a chunk of hillside giving way and a cascade of mud, rocks and trees sparking clouds of dust below. Sadly, landslides are more widespread than any other geological event.

Sadly, the death toll has now raised to 31 and there are still another 150 people still feared missing and unaccounted for. Chances of rescuing any of these missing people appears to be slim as it has been more than 36 hours since Wednesday's landslide. Apparently, the disaster only came to light when a bus driver passed by and saw that the village had been wiped out.
The latest reports out of India indicate that 44 houses were completely flattened by the landslide disaster. 70 people have been confirmed dead, including 28 males, 32 females and 10 children.

The village is on the verge of extinction with nearly 20 dead and many others critically injured.Total population of the village is 700 and nearly 150 were critical...250 still feared trapped..I sincerely pray for their well being.!!!

The latest reports have the death toll at 79 people with 8 people rescued alive. A spokeswoman for the National Disaster Management Authority said today that they are expecting to pull out a total of 153 bodies.

About 160 people were buried under mud and rocks after heavy rainfall during the night that led to a rapid landslide. At least 25 have been killedd and another 200 feared to be trapped under mud and debris. Rocks and mud destroyed people's homes after a nearby hill collapsed. Mind you this was a remote and poor village with very weak structured dwellings.
Seven people have died and a further 20 people remain missing after a landslide hit a village in Southwest China on Wednesday, August 27

More than 100 people have been buried under tons of mud and rubble for two days as a massive landslide hit central Sri Lanka. Hundreds of troops have been using heavy equipment to dig through tonnes of mud that buried the tin-roofed homes of workers at a tea plantation. Authorities have evacuated hundreds of people from nearby villages due to fears of fresh landslides. Unfortunately, bad weather has hampered rescue and recovery efforts.
A landslide triggered by torrential rain has killed at least 3 people and left 107 others missing on Indonesias main island of Java.

Phoenix had a bad line of thunderstorms come through during the night, causing flooding, massive power outages, and stranding people in cars and on rooftops. Rescue workers used helicopters to reach people who were inaccessible by any other means. Over two inches of rain fell in about an hour's time, and Maricopa County has flood warnings up for the whole area. Fortunately, there were no fatalities, at least at this point.
